sourcesContent:
import React from 'react' function GraphOp(props) { const {gr,setGr,ch,st,type,setSt,count} = props let line const addVertex = (e) => { e.preventDefault() setOp("") let value = document.getElementById("input1").value value = parseInt(value,10) const fullStruc = (st.find(e => e.id === ch.id)) let myStruc = fullStruc.tile //array of coordinates let [r,c] = myStruc[0] const newGrid = gr.slice() let i for(i =0; i<15;){ console.log("in there") if(gr[r][c].txt > value){ i = 2*i+1 if(typeof(myStruc[i])==="undefined") break r = myStruc[i][0] //left child c = myStruc[i][1] //left child } else{ i = 2*i+2 if(typeof(myStruc[i])==="undefined") break r = myStruc[i][0] //right child c = myStruc[i][1] //right child } } if(i>14) return //reached tree depth limit let newR,newC, offset = [0,4,4,2,2,2,2,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1] let g = gr[r][c] //parent if(g.txt > value){ newR = r +1 newC = c - offset[i] } else{ newR = r +1 newC = c + offset[i] } const aTile = newGrid[newR][newC]//child if(typeof(aTile) == "undefined" || !(aTile.strType === "")) return //tile is already being used const newTile= { ...aTile, txt:`${value}`, strType: type.TREE, strId:fullStruc.id, myKey: g.myKey +""+newC //for unique keys } newGrid[newR][newC] = newTile setGr(newGrid) const newSt = st.filter(e => !(e.id ===fullStruc.id)).slice()//list of data structures without tree myStruc[i]=[newR,newC] newSt.push({id:ch.id,type:"tree",tile:myStruc}) setSt(newSt) console.log(st) } return (
) } export default GraphOp
